thread.title: M’sians not keen on visiting North Korea
thread.title_full: M’sians not keen on visiting North Korea

title: M’sians not keen on visiting North Korea
text:
Wednesday, 22 February 2017 M’sians not keen on visiting North Korea 
PETALING JAYA: Malaysians are the only people in the world that do not need a visa to set foot in North Korea, but travel agencies say there have been no takers. 
According to the DPR Korea Tourism website, what Malaysian passport holders need is an entry-permit. 
To get this, a visitor only needs to purchase a full package tour that includes hotel accommodation, transfers and meals through an accredited travel agency. 
Urban Rhythms Tours, Adventures and Travel director Nigel Wong said his firm received no enquiries from tourists to go to North Korea. 
“We also do not offer packages to North Korea as we have never considered doing so,” he said. 
Dayangti Transport and Tours director S. Jayakumar said he had never heard of Malaysians wanting to go to North Korea.
